There are many things about the game that are great, game play is smooth, hardly any glitches. But there are cheaters utilising hacks where they disappear under the map and attack unseen, often increasing their own speed and weapon damage in the process. You report these cheats, but don't get feedback on if they have been banned. If you leave a match before the end (usually when someone is cheating) you are penalised - leave too often and you can suffer a matchmaking penalty.  The game structure is 'Pay to Win'  and there is always going to be someone out there willing to spend more than you. You arent guaranteed the things you want in the boxes you buy - encouraging you to continue buying and even when you do get the latest bot with the most powerful weapons, at the end of that season, they nerf everything youve spent money on - down. Then release a new tranche of bots and weapons all way more powerful than yours - now the cycle begins again. I'm at the point where I figure Ive spent enough money on my robot hangars now,, not planning on giving them any more.

fun game but be prepared to either 
A. devote every waking moment to grinding
B. Get a second job to buy pay to win robots

as long as you don't spend your life savings on this game, you will get steamrolled by other players all the time. This doesn't mean you won't win the match, however, since the game pretty much decides if you will win the next match you play based on your current win rate. It tries to keep it at 50%. So whether or not you buy the next meta cycle only decides how easy engagement will be, and only against players who spend less. The only way to be able to win more than lose is to play with a full squad of maxed players, where you will then match against the same. Then the more skillful team wins. In short, super pay to win game in terms of engagement within battles, not so much in terms of winning games. It does get easier with time, albeit a LOT of time. I would say you have to put in at roughly 400 hrs for it to happen. Very fun gameplay loop when your'e not getting your skull bashed in, though. And please for the love of all that is good DON'T GIVE THESE PEOPLE YOUR MONEY!
very good game, just dont buy anything from the store you will get addicted on purchasing

The absolute worst P2W I've ever experienced in a game. Do not waste your time or space downloading this. Multiple attempts to generate purchases every time you return to the main menu. Being a new player in low-tier matches pits you against players who have already purchased hundreds worth of premium currency and mechs, and if you think you stand a chance against mommy's credit card, you're wrong.
Awesome and fun game but the ptw ruins the fun.
Fun mobile-style mech shooter with lots of customization. However, it's extremely pay-to-win

I like giant robot games and I really hate leaving do not recommends.  I should love this game and if I don't I usually don't leave a review.  Sadly, I don't.  It's slower than Mech Warrior.  I can see if some mechs are slower than others, but they all seem to be roughly the same.  Torso rotation didn't seem to make a diffirence between light and heavier mechs.  It seems the only difference between them is capability to carry heavier weapons, speed and armor/life.  The customization of your mech is nice, but it's a pain to get additional parts.  Also, my twitch intergration didn't work, so the free parts for watching streams was useless.   Might revisit to see what work they've done, but as is right now, just not a fan.  I think the game does have potential, though, especially for a free game.  Difficulty ramp is a bit steep, and I suspect it's p2w (it usually is in f2p), but I got bored before investing enough time to find out.  Speaking of time, the time delay to improve mechs is really irritating, nothing like a game you can't play while you wait for your mech to improve (in real time) after investing credits.  I don't know why devs insist on this mechanic.  I get that they want you to pay money to *not* wait 2 days for your mech to upgrade,  but what is just going to happen is I'll stop playing your game for 2 days, and then some other new shiny will get my attention and I'm just that much more likely to never play your game again.  Especially when there's all the hotness out there that you're competing against if your game is the hottest one out there, which (to be clear) this game, very much, is not.

TL;DR  If you're not a fan of giant robots, this probably isn't for you.  Even if you are a fan of giant robots smashing the crap out of each other, there's better games than this.  But it's f2p, so why don't you give it a shot?  All you have to lose is the very finite time you have left in this world, after all.

If they could add some variant of scaling when it comes to the matches i would have no issues with the game. But as it sits now, this game is dog water, absolute trash. Fix it.

I am so sad to say this, but War Robots is actually a bad game nowadays.
I have played this game for long periods of time in my Childhood, it used to be an absolute banger. The Robots were so interesting, the gameplay was so good and the community was actually great. I can actually remember that their greediness started in those years, but it was nowhere near as bad as it's today. It's a literal catastrophy of what it is today, everything is locked down behind a paywall, and their excuse is that you can actually grind to get whatever Robot or Weapon you want. Even though grinding in this game is terrible.
The developers managed to completely destroy this game, the community now is so toxic, and skill based matchmaking is completely gone. Because the developers know well that the player who pays the most, is the winner.
Robots aren't worth it anymore, because they get weal in the next season, not because they nerfed it, but simply because a better robot released.
It's sad to see my favorite childhood game drenched in infinite progress bars, fancy robots locked behind paywalls, and everything requires currencies you can't even get through normal matches. And the issue is that the rewards you get from winning a match is completely useless, you can pay 5$ to get gold bars that are worth dozens of matches rewards.
This game had the potential to be a really good game, I mean the idea that big robots fighting with cool weapons is just so good, and in an addition to the huge variety of robots abilities like Double jump or a magical shield or dash adds depth to your builds. But the developers realized that this kind of mechanics will not pay rent easily. Shame on you, Pixonic Games / MY.GAMES, shame on you.
Shit game. Can't transfer my android account to this. It is a hell hole of pay to win type game that you visit annually but you can't do it on PC. Huuuhhh...

The gameplay and potential is there. But of course when you go into a match with regular robots you get from playing the game legitimately and the enemy team consists of giant alien spider robots that shoot electrical balls that do 5 figures of damage per hit, the game suddenly becomes less fun and reminds you it is simply a port of a mobile game. A cheap cash grab with the only way to actually get an advantage is by forking over hundreds of dollars just to survive for more than a minute. Stop ruining every single game with P2W mechanics. I understand a free game needs revenue. But make the paid elements just to speed up upgrades or to get cosmetics. Don't make it so that a level 10 with a credit card is 5x more powerful than a level 30 without one
have plenty of hours on this game on my phone, obvious pay to win model and developers are showing no signs of trying to change that, disgusting.

Don't even bother downloading this game, it is awful, too much pay to win and certainly introducing the ultimate bots and weapons make it impossible to win against unless you had your own. The ultimate versions of the robots are literally impossible to kill unless you spend a load of money which most likely won't work because someone will always spend more.
Another problem is that some ships like "Beholder" for example is just plain annoying as the beam keeps chasing a specific target and certainly more annoying since most robots can't outrun it and another ship called "Thor" is another can of worms, the damage out put of that ship is so high that it can literally almost kill most robots before they can even leave the damage zone. Highly recommend not downloading this game unless you want to be a punching bag for those that spend thousands on the game, you can't out compete high spenders.

TL;DR: The rich is hunting the poor for fun. Do not support it.

Only fun for the first 9-10 rounds, until matchmaking system keeps sending you to fight those spent a lot.
In one match, I got hit constantly by an expensive bot with double top-tier high level weapon and get shredded without leaving the spawn point, not even with the default Titan (i.e. another bot with technically more HP and DMG).

Only pay to win, once you progress past the tutorial its impossible to play the game without spending real life money, developers are a cash grab and had a really good game but made it suck with heavily rewarding those who spend their own money and dont actually play the game.

I've currently played for 15 hours and when the games are reasonably well matched it's a fun game, but that's rarely the case as the matchmaking is rubbish.  Often matched with people 9 levels higher than me and with pay to win purchased robots and weapons.  Maybe there's just not enough "newer" people, they probably give up for exactly this reason :D

Now on to the real problem with the game... every day when you log in you're faced with around 16 different "buy now for real money!" screens like a mobile game.  Anything from easily earned in game money up to uber powered robots and guns.

As with other online games some game types are often under populated such as Beacon Rush, where as Team Deathmatch is easy to get into but again populated with people who have paid to win so...

Meh is my opinion, lots of better games you could play other than this so it's a thumbs down from me

horrific matchmaking system, downloaded the game a week ago have a few hours of playtime, facing people with super high level equipment which i can do nothing about, pointless and unenjoyable unless your willing to sink hundreds into the game constantly. miss how this game was 5 years ago when i would play it on my ipad before the developers got consumed by greed and completely disregarded the feelings of the whole community

decent gameplay if you ignore the pay gap between strong players and free players...

problem: you cannot ignore the paygap. New robots shift balance heavily, upgrade times are unreasonably bad, and the only way to get around these headaches? microtransactions. 

for reference: 
new player who spends heavily on microstransaction in a few days becomes much more powerful than a player that has stayed a small spender / free to play who is playing for 3-5 yrs. how do i know? i have 2 acc's: 
- 1 was made during the early days of the game when the Stalker bot was considered strong
- the other is the one tied to this account and i've speant a little, around dolphin levels of spending
when compared side by side the newer one is much more well off when it comes to win rates in the game as compared to one that has been grinding for a long time.

recommended if you have expendable income you wouldn't mind spending
not recommended if you want to simply have fun without having to pay hand over fist to be considered a "mid" player

I like everything about this game except for the microtransactions that pretty much completely ruin it. Unless you're extremely rich and have a lot of money to waste, you probably won't be into this game as most things are locked behind a paywall or extreme grind if you don't want to pay.
Pay to win, can not enjoy this game without people one shoting you from across the map, and Pixonic just destroyed this game.

This game WAS so cool. Key word: WAS. It used to be about killing enemy robots and having fun. Now it is all pay to win GARBAGE!!!
PS: Hackers are common too. But don't bother reporting them, because it does nothing.

P2W piece of garbage, first of all its a portal of the mobile game, so its not a real PC game, the game looks and feel like 20 years old, mechs are damn slow and so stiff, movement is clunky, and basic movement like jumping is not for all robots and locked in game behind coins gateway to use it, aim system is BS and will switch mid fight to another target on its own, the option to turn off weapons is not working all weapons will shoot all the time, AI is retarded, and team mates will annoy you and keep shooting you for some reason with no TK in the game but just for enjoyment or something, first couple levels its meh, after level 7 its total BS against retarded ppl who pay money to play mobile games. 

Just save your time and money, stay away and go play the newer version of the game War Robots: Frontiers, at least there you can enjoy it and actually win matches without having to pay to win if you play smart.

This game is Hella fun but due to how p2w it is, it makes it very hard to have that fun.

i was playing war robots from 2019 where i get to know that the state of the game is pay to win, but i still enjoy game i reached diamaond 2 with avenger ao jun, glacier natasha, wasp fujin and viper raijin and i love my hangar and leave in 2021 i come back in 2025 but what the fuu*** is this game now ,bot will destroyed within 10 seconds if you do not have meta relevant robot and weapons mmeans if you want to atleast stand  20 -30 seconds of gameplay with each robot you have to give your wallet to pigsonic and after some time like 4 months all your weapon got nerfed many times and you have to spend again for new meta

Looking at this game in a few years watching my friend play it. What happened? the pay to win mechanics took over and the game isn't fun anymore. I compared the steam severs to the iOS severs and they are both equally terrible. Steam for the instability, and iOS for the blatant Pay-to-Win formula. Started when Heimdall was added, left when Curie was added.  Best descision of my life

what pay to win game is all about you don't spend thousands on this game you can expect to die in 10 seconds or less. all matches your level is not factor in match making . the amount of people who dropped  money to pay to win is unbelievable. all stock credit mechs don't even stand chance to survive some bots that are pay to win can't even damage even with titans.
it aint Dat good lowk low buget Plus ther all bots and not players and u only have guns

I now remember why when i played on mobile i hated this game, decided to try on PC again, still hate it. 2/10. it has potential but like most multiplayer games it does not allow for new players to be placed against others with similar skill levels and/or hangers. All commons (mechs and weapons) and i am always being put against people that have a full kitted legendary mech, with legendary weapons, pilot (which i don't even have unlocked) a pet of some kind and more that i simply don't have access to at lvl 10 without spending way too much on this game. If they could add some variant of scaling when it comes to the matches i would have no issues with the game. But as it sits now, this game is dog water, absolute trash. Fix it.

Pay to win, the game used to be fun, 5 years ago, now you cant even play without being killed in seconds even when it takes you 15 minutes to kill anyone. 
Don't play this game, it will make you angry. the developers don't know how to do there job, the game could be so fun with some tweeks to make it fair, but they are money hungry greedy arse holes.

60 hours into the game, and i want a refund on every single one of them this game is pure P2W, period, its a tempting trap for fat, greedy devs to get your money, because humans basically want instant dopamine, which is prob what they exploited here, a single button to get the most advanced robots and weapons, just to get some damn money, i was not satisfied of playing this game, its: 0% skill, 100% depending on your wallet i'm not going to sugarcoat it; DON'T play this game, play something else!
Unevenly matched, level 13 noobs against sometimes more than 3 level 30's that pay to win on the opposite team.

I want to play with tier 1 robots and tier 1 weapons only. I must have had over 6 accounts, and I quit when I am pushed up into Silver league with my Kid Titan. Play this game with only one robot until you get bored.
